DOC.brief_summary: Background The Al-Andalus physical activity intervention study randomise control trial investigate effectiveness land- water-based exercise intervention reduce overall impact fibromyalgia ( primary outcome ) , improve tenderness pain-related measure , body composition , functional capacity , physical activity sedentary behaviour , fatigue , sleep quality , health-related quality life , cognitive function ( secondary outcome ) woman fibromyalgia . Methods One hundred eighty woman fibromyalgia ( age range : 35-65 year ) recruit local association fibromyalgia patient Andaluc√≠a ( Southern Spain ) . Patients randomly assign usual care ( control ) group ( n=60 ) , water-based exercise intervention group ( n=60 ) land-based exercise intervention group ( n=60 ) . Participants usual care group receive general physical activity guideline participant allocate intervention group attend three non-consecutive training session ( 60 minute ) per week 24 week . Both exercise intervention consist aerobic , muscular strength flexibility exercise . Discussion The investigator study attempt reduce impact fibromyalgia improve patient ' health status implement two type exercise intervention . Results study help assess efficacy exercise intervention treatment fibromyalgia . If intervention would effective , study provide low-cost feasible alternative health professional management fibromyalgia . Results Al-Andalus physical activity intervention help well understand potential regular physical activity improve well-being woman fibromyalgia .
DOC.criteria: Age : 3565 year . Meeting American College Rheumatology criterion : widespread pain 3 month , pain 4 kg/cm pressure report 11 18 tender point . Not severe somatic psychiatric disorder , disease prevent physical loading ( Answer `` '' question Physical Activity Readiness QuestionnairePARQ ) . Not engage regular physical activity > 20 minute > 3 days/week . Planning stay Association study . Able ambulate , without assistance . Able communicate . Informed consent : Must capable willing provide consent . Acute terminal illness . Myocardial infarction past 3 month . Not capable ambulate . Unstable cardiovascular disease medical condition . Upper low extremity fracture past 3 month . Severe dementia ( MMSE < 10 ) . Unwillingness either complete study requirement randomise control training group . Presence neuromuscular disease drug affect neuromuscular function .
